thread.title: PGA Tour player Pat Perez rips Tiger Woods
thread.title_full: PGA Tour player Pat Perez rips Tiger Woods

title: PGA Tour player Pat Perez rips Tiger Woods

organizations.name: kentucky now stream live pga tour

text:
Stream #13 Florida @ #11 Kentucky Now Stream Live PGA Tour player Pat Perez rips Tiger Woods Pat Perez isn't one of the more familiar names on the PGA Tour, but the journeyman pro got his name in headlines this week by making some bold statements about Tiger Slot to 247Sports Links 
Pat Perez isn't one of the more familiar names on the PGA Tour, but the journeyman pro got his name in headlines this week by making some bold statements about Tiger Woods. 
Perez, who has known Woods for decades going back to their junior golf days, said Woods "knows he can't beat anybody" on Sirius XM PGA Tour radio this week. 
Perez wasn't done. 
"He’s got this new corporation that he started, so he’s got to keep his name relevant to keep the corporation going," Perez was quoted as saying by golf.com . "He’s going to show up to a few events, he’s going to try to play. He’s gotta go out there and show the Monster Bag, he’s going to show the TaylorMade driver. He’s going to get on TV, he’s got the Nike clothes, he’s gotta keep that stuff relevant. But the bottom line is he knows he can’t beat anybody. He knows it." 
Perez went on to say he thinks there is a chance Woods' career is finished. 
"If he doesn’t play Augusta (The Masters), then it’s over. I can tell you that right now," Perez said. "Personally, I don’t think you’ll see him again this year. I think he’s out. I don’t think you’ll see him again." 
Woods got wind of Perez's comments, and according to Golf Digest Tiger was less than pleased. Perez backtracked on his comments a bit after texting with Woods. 
“I’m not Tiger bashing, I’m not saying he’s not the greatest,” Perez said to Golf Digest. “That was me and my co-host [Michael Collins] talking about the current what-ifs of Tiger’s situation. I have done nothing but praise him my entire career.” 
Woods has battled injuries for much of the last two seasons and recently withdrew from Genesis Open and Honda Classic because of issues with his back. Author
